intro: Sterculia punctata, commonly known as the spotted sterculia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and showy, yellow flowers with red veins. It produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. Sterculia punctata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
